tit.cmt: 読みにもなるので日本語を入れました。

sen.j: 準譜代大名（じゅんふだいだいみょう）外様大名の中で、幕閣において長年の功績のある大名を始めとして、主に血縁関係により譜代大名に準ずる家格の大名をいう。
sen.e: A quasi fudai daimyo was the another name for tozama daimyo (nonhereditary feudal lord) who had a social standing following a fudai daimyo by the longtime achievement in the cabinet officials of the Shogunate, and the relationship.

A quasi fudai daimyo refers to some tozama daimyo (outsider to the ruler) clans, who became treated as fudai daimyo clans (relative or very close to the ruler), mainly in regards to the blood relations to the ruling family of the Edo period in Japan, mainly because of their the clans' achievement over the time.
sen.cmt: 外様大名のanother nameではなく、外様大名の中の一部分です。また、外様の説明が誤解を招く言い方のように思えました（対訳のところに入っていたようですが）ので変更しました。
sen.e: A quasi fudai daimyo refers to some tozama daimyo (outsider to the ruler) clans, who became treated as fudai daimyo clans (relative or very close to the ruler), mainly in regards to the blood relations to the ruling family of the Edo period in Japan, mainly because of their the clans' achievement over the time.

sen.j: あくまでも、後世に便宜上使用されている呼称であり、同時代である近世江戸時代にはこの呼称はない。
sen.e: However, this name came to be used later for convenience, so there was not this name in the early-modern times of the Edo Period.
This name came to be used later for convenience, so those clans were not called with this name at the time of the Edo period.
This name came to be used later for convenience, so those clans were not called with this name at the time of the Edo period.

sen.j: 正しくは願い譜代または御譜代に準ずる大名という。
sen.e: It was called Negai fudai or a daimyo following Gofudai correctly.
The correct term is a negai fudai (a fudai clan who requested the government to be a fudai), or a daimyo that is pursuant to a fudai daimyo.
The correct term is a negai fudai (a fudai clan who requested the government to be a fudai), or a daimyo that is pursuant to a fudai daimyo.

tit.cmt: 譜代大名というより、譜代大名「家」に与えられるタイトルなので、clanを入れました。

sen.j: 秋田氏陸奥国三春藩5万石 城
sen.e: The Akita clan: Miharu Domain, Mutsu Province assessed at 50,000 koku and had a Castle
The Akita clan: Miharu Domain, Mutsu Province, assessed at 50,000 koku, with its castle allowed
sen.cmt: 城を持っていた、というより、城を持つ格を許された、という意味なので表現を変更しました。
sen.e: The Akita clan: Miharu Domain, Mutsu Province, assessed at 50,000 koku, with its castle allowed

sen.j: 有馬氏越前国丸岡藩5万石 城
sen.e: The Arima clan: Maruoka Domain, Echizen Province assessed at 50,000 koku and had a Castle
The Arima clan: Maruoka Domain, Echizen Province, assessed at 50,000 koku, with its castle allowed
The Arima clan: Maruoka Domain, Echizen Province, assessed at 50,000 koku, with its castle allowed

sen.j: 遠藤氏近江国三上藩1万石 陣屋
sen.e: The Endo clan: Mikami Domain, Omi Province assessed at 10,000 koku and had Jinya (regional government office)
The Endo clan: Mikami Domain, Omi Province, assessed at 10,000 koku, with its jinya, official residence, allowed.
sen.cmt: 陣屋はgovernment officeではなく大名の陣屋ですので表現をあらためました。
sen.e: The Endo clan: Mikami Domain, Omi Province, assessed at 10,000 koku, with its jinya, official residence, allowed.
